member.name: T:Serilog.ILogger
member.summary: The core Serilog logging API, used for writing log events.
member.remarks: The methods on (and its static sibling ) are guaranteed never to throw exceptions. Methods on all other types may.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.ForContext(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Serilog.Core.ILogEventEnricher})
member.summary: Create a logger that enriches log events via the provided enrichers.
member.param: Enrichers that apply in the context.
member.returns: A logger that will enrich log events as specified.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.ForContext(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a logger that enriches log events with the specified property.
member.returns: A logger that will enrich log events as specified.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.ForContext``1
member.summary: Create a logger that marks log events as being from the specified source type.
member.typeparam: Type generating log messages in the context.
member.returns: A logger that will enrich log events as specified.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.ForContext(System.Type)
member.summary: Create a logger that marks log events as being from the specified source type.
member.param: Type generating log messages in the context.
member.returns: A logger that will enrich log events as specified.

member.param: The event to write.

member.summary: Write a log event with the specified level.
member.param: The level of the event.

Exception related to the event.
Message template describing the event.
Objects positionally formatted into the message template.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.IsEnabled(Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel)
member.summary: Determine if events at the specified level will be passed through to the log sinks.
member.param: Level to check.
member.returns: True if the level is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.Verbose(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write a log event with the level and associated exception.
member.param: Message template describing the event.
Objects positionally formatted into the message template.
member.example: Log.Verbose("Staring into space, wondering if we're alone.");

member.name: M:Serilog.ILogger.Verbose(System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write a log event with the level and associated exception.
member.param: Exception related to the event.
Message template describing the event.
Objects positionally formatted into the message template.
member.example: Log.Verbose(ex, "Staring into space, wondering where this comet came from.");

member.name: T:Serilog.Log
member.summary: An optional static entry point for logging that can be easily referenced by different parts of an application. To configure the set the Logger static property to a logger instance.
member.remarks: The methods on (and its dynamic sibling ) are guaranteed never to throw exceptions. Methods on all other types may.

member.name: T:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration object for creating instances.

member.name: P:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.WriteTo
member.summary: Configures the sinks that log events will be emitted to.

member.name: P:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.MinimumLevel
member.summary: Configures the minimum level at which events will be passed to sinks. If not specified, only events at the level and above will be passed through.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: P:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.Enrich
member.summary: Configures enrichment of s. Enrichers can add, remove and modify the properties associated with events.

member.name: P:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.Filter
member.summary: Configures global filtering of s.

member.name: P:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.Destructure
member.summary: Configures destructuring of message template parameters.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfiguration.CreateLogger
member.summary: Create a logger using the configured sinks, enrichers and minimum level.
member.returns: The logger.
member.remarks: To free resources held by sinks ahead of program shutdown, the returned logger may be cast to and disposed.

member.name: T:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration
member.summary: Controls template parameter destructuring configuration.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.AsScalar(System.Type)
member.summary: Treat objects of the specified type as scalar values, i.e., don't break them down into properties event when destructuring complex types.
member.param: Type to treat as scalar.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.AsScalar``1
member.summary: Treat objects of the specified type as scalar values, i.e., don't break them down into properties event when destructuring complex types.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.With(Serilog.Core.IDestructuringPolicy[])
member.summary: When destructuring objects, transform instances with the provided policies.
member.param: Policies to apply when destructuring.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.With``1
member.summary: When destructuring objects, transform instances with the provided policy.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.ByTransforming``1(System.Func{``0,System.Object})
member.summary: When destructuring objects, transform instances of the specified type with the provided function.
member.param: Function mapping instances of to an alternative representation.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerDestructuringConfiguration.ToMaximumDepth(System.Int32)
member.summary: When destructuring objects, depth will be limited to 5 property traversals deep to guard against ballooning space when recursive/cyclic structures are accidentally passed. To increase this limit pass a higher value.
member.param: The maximum depth to use.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.summary: Controls enrichment configuration.

member.summary: Specifies one or more enrichers that may add properties dynamically to log events.
member.param: Enrichers to apply to all events passing through the logger.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.summary: Specifies an enricher that may add properties dynamically to log events.
member.typeparam: Enricher type to apply to all events passing through the logger.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerEnrichmentConfiguration.WithProperty(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Include the specified property value in all events logged to the logger.
member.param: The name of the property to add.
The property value to add.
If true, objects of unknown type will be logged as structures; otherwise they will be converted using .
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.summary: Functionality is unavailable, invariants are broken or data is lost.

member.summary: Write log events to the provided .
member.param: The text writer to write log events to.
Message template describing the output format.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration.Logger(System.Action{Serilog.LoggerConfiguration},Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel)
member.summary: Write log events to a sub-logger, where further processing may occur. Events through the sub-logger will be constrained by filters and enriched by enrichers that are active in the parent. A sub-logger cannot be used to log at a more verbose level, but a less verbose level is possible.
member.param: An action that configures the sub-logger.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.name: M:Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration.Observers(System.Action{System.IObservable{Serilog.Events.LogEvent}},Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel)
member.summary: Write events to Rx observers.
member.param: An action that provides an observable to which observers can subscribe.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.
member.returns: Configuration object allowing method chaining.

member.summary: If supported, destructure the provided value.

Recursively apply policies to destructure additional values.
The destructured value, or null.
member.returns: True if the value could be destructured under this policy.

member.summary: Returns true if the provided event is enabled. Otherwise, false.
member.param: The event to test.
member.returns: True if the event is enabled by this filter. If false is returned, the event will not be emitted.

member.name: T:Serilog.Core.ILogEventPropertyFactory
member.summary: Creates log event properties from regular .NET objects, applying policies as required.

member.name: M:Serilog.Core.ILogEventPropertyFactory.CreateProperty(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct a with the specified name and value.
member.param: The name of the property.
The value of the property.

If true, and the value is a non-primitive, non-array type, then the value will be converted to a structure; otherwise, unknown types will be converted to scalars, which are generally stored as strings.

member.name: T:Serilog.Core.ILogEventPropertyValueFactory
member.summary: Supports the policy-driven construction of s given regular .NET objects.

member.name: M:Serilog.Core.ILogEventPropertyValueFactory.CreatePropertyValue(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a given a .NET object and destructuring strategy.
member.param: The value of the property.

If true, and the value is a non-primitive, non-array type, then the value will be converted to a structure; otherwise, unknown types will be converted to scalars, which are generally stored as strings.
member.returns: The value.

member.name: T:Serilog.Formatting.Display.MessageTemplateTextFormatter
member.summary: A that supports the Serilog message template format. Formatting log events for display has a different set of requirements and expectations from rendering the data within them. To meet this, the formatter overrides some behavior: First, strings are always output as literals (not quoted) unless some other format is applied to them. Second, tokens without matching properties are skipped rather than being written as raw text.

A string that will be written after each log event is formatted. If null, will be used. Ignored if is true.
If true, the message will be rendered and written to the output as a property named RenderedMessage.
